final_answer:
The image is satirical because it juxtaposes two contrasting scenarios. On the left, a stick figure enthusiastically encourages a woman to "Smile!" with an exclamation mark, suggesting a positive or cheerful action. However, the woman appears to be reacting with her hands on her head, possibly indicating skepticism or frustration.

On the right side, the close-up of a face with wrinkles and circled areas humorously highlights the unintended consequences of smiling, such as the formation of wrinkles. The title "YES, BUT" further emphasizes this contrast, suggesting that while smiling is socially encouraged, it may have undesired side effects. This creates a humorous twist on societal expectations and beauty standards.
ground_truth: The image is ironical because while it suggests people to smile it also shows the wrinkles that can be caused around lips and eyes because of smiling
